website_summaries.verdict: An innovative breast pump that rivals the performance of industry leaders but comes up just short in terms of durability.
pros: A breast pump that offers powerful yet gentle milk expression and quiet operation
cons: Several reports of units breaking down after a few months of use

customer_reviews.title: worked great for all of three months
customer_reviews.text: worked great for all of three months. Just started warranty process and it's already a nightmare. Customer service not answering their phone. The website says that the first step before any warranty is obtained is to send them a video showing them exactly how the product is not working. Then the next step is to send a warranty claim and they warn in big bold letters: If you send two claims, we will deny your warranty request!! I almost feel like i'm causing them a serious inconvenience with my warranty claim. mastitis, engorgement, baby feeding, not having a pump for two weeks are all problems that they seem very unconcerned about.
customer_reviews.author: mna86

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Just wow. A weight has been lifted from my shoulders.
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Just wow. Why did I not hear of this pump sooner? Comfortable, portable, lightweight, oh- and more than double the milk!! Seriously, it is almost a crime that the insurance companies just give out inferior pumps when this is available. I was concerned when returning to work with my second baby that I would not be able to produce enough milk. With my first, I pumped like 6 times a day at work to make enough with my Medela PISA. Now, those worries are gone. Totally gone! The proof is in the pictures. 10 mins of total comfort and quiet on the Spectra vs 20 mins of loud wrenching and pulling on the PISA.
customer_reviews.author: Candice Hansen

customer_reviews.title: WHEN it works it is great. But they die in a couple months.
customer_reviews.text: WHEN this pump works it is the best pump on the market!! It has the best customization as far as rhythm, suction and speed. I get the most with it. I have tried the Medela Symphony in the hospital, a PISA, the Ameda Purely Yours, and the Evenflo none come close to this pump. The problem is these pumps die and the manufacturer warranty does not apply to Amazon purchases. I have now had two of these die in 9 months. What happens is when you turn the off the screen goes off but the machine will continue to pump until the battery dies, and then it will never turn back on. I am now buying a third pump :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Update: Love pump! Mine may be faulty though....
customer_reviews.text: Update!!! After 9weeks of bliss the pump lost all suction and already had a power button issue. I looked up a ton of troubleshooting guides and tried everything!! I rely on this pump and am really really x1000 screwed without it. Trying to get another immediately but not happy with the return/replace process so far! Original reveiw- Love the s1! But!! Sometimes I have to push the power button twice for it to turn on... I hope it doesn't get worse because I use the pump l 2-4times a day and can't go without it. Baby loves the nipple style of the bottles! All parts are easily washable with a pump brush set! Love this pump!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: well you have found what you are looking for look no further
customer_reviews.text: I stared pumping three days ago to get my supply up, that being said, I Absolutely, without a doubt, would refer anybody and everybody to use this pump! I am a mom of six and this pump works fast and efficiently so I can get back to taking care of my little ones. I take it with in the car and use it at night love love LOVE this pump. It's an Absolute must.
customer_reviews.author: nicolle

customer_reviews.title: Strong suction power - similar to hospital grade pumps
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Medela Freestyle pump before my baby arrived and as ended up buying this Spectra afterward based on recommendations from lactation consultants. The lactation consultants told me this pump is the only one aside from hospital grade pumps that have decent suction. Of all the features (including portability - which this one isn’t the best for), the suction power is easily the most important to me now that I’m actually pumping. I’d recommend this over the Medela Freestyle if you’re on the fence.
customer_reviews.author: Zee

customer_reviews.title: Great if it actually worked
customer_reviews.text: Worked super great when I first purchased. Was quieter then the medela I had with my previous kids. Really enjoyed the ability to change the suction strength and speed. If it still worked I would give it a 5/5 but it cuts off randomly mid pump. For the money I spend that’s complete crap and not worth it when the medela which is the same price works the same 5 years after purchasing it. This Spectra has lasted 3 months since I first used it.
customer_reviews.author: Lindly Marquis

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!! Listen to the buyers here :)
customer_reviews.text: After an awful experience with my eldest, I decided to prepare in advance, read amazon reviews and decided to purchase the Spectra while i was pregnant. I'm pumping it solely for 4 months now. Good suction, very quiet (I pump next to my sleeping baby which jumps from every small sound) and can walk around with it. So far the battery works really well (I pump 40 mins each time, also on the roads so usually not plugged). Really happy with the purchase and highly reccomend! The only downside is with the bottles- they don't screw very well so lost a few amounts of milk (3 bottles and probably still counting).. :/
customer_reviews.author: trofotti

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy from amazon.  But from spectra.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy a pump from amazon. This came uncalibrated at the wrong speed/vaccume strength and my supply tanked. I have another spectra at home luckily which is at the right speed/vacuume level.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rakhit

customer_reviews.title: Not that great...
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 3 stars because I do not think that this pump is that great. Yes the cordless/battery option is probably the best part about it as well as the quieter pumping sound. I do not get more milk production than the madella pump and the parts feel cheap to me. The hoses are constantly falling off, the lid does not stay on the bottle that well and the clear labels on the bottle make it hard to read the ounces pumped. I havent used the nightlight feature yet because i havent had a need for it. The power button is also sensative so when being carried to the car or the mothers lounge my pump randomly turns on.
customer_reviews.author: Amy F.

customer_reviews.title: Don't understand the hype--Parts are difficult and not compatible with pumping bras
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good pump, definitely quieter than the Medela Pump n Style. It's also probably better at pumping, but only slightly. But I absolutely do not understand the pump parts. They are not at all compatible with pumping bras and are generally difficult to use. You also can't really see the oz on the bottles, and the tubing is difficult to connect. Medela wins in these areas, hands down. I'd recommend renting a Medela Symphony if you want strong suction and a quiet pump.
customer_reviews.author: C. Brozek

customer_reviews.title: Received Faulty Unit – Spectra Amended
customer_reviews.text: Update: New pump received, works great. Super quiet. We’re happy with it! Let this be a heads up to new parents out there - check your gear before “go time” so you aren’t trying to feed a newborn and deal with trying to return/exchange faulty gear at the same time! —- Seems like it could be a great pump but I received a faulty unit (see video) - I purchased the S1 specifically to have a portable unit but this unit won’t carry a charge at all, so I have to leave it plugged into the wall at all times.
customer_reviews.author: Yasso

customer_reviews.title: YESS WORTH IT
customer_reviews.text: I was given a Medela through my insurance. It was like the PISA but smaller and I HATED it. My nips felt like they were being sucked to it’s death each time. I was planning to pump at work and was scared that the medela would contribute to a milk decrease even more so than Normal so I pulled the plug and bought the spectra after the recommendations from friends and coworkers. AND OMG, this thing works wonders! I get more milk than I ever did with my medela. On top of that, I love the massage mode and the ability to change the pace and suction separately! I’d totally recommend this to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Pea

customer_reviews.title: The pump stops working after 4 months of use
customer_reviews.text: The Spectra S1 Plus has all the features I want, night light, a screen to look at the pumping duration, cute appearance, rechargeable battery, ONLY IF IT IS FUNCTIONAL!!! I am so disappointed by the fact that the pump stops working after only 4 months of use! I have to get back work 6 weeks after delivery, which means I am an exclusive pumping mom. So a functional pump is very important to me!! I was so frustrated that morning when I found my pump did not turn on properly, I had to purchase another pump in the nearest Walmart. It ruined my day!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE the Spectra
customer_reviews.text: LOVE the Spectra. I have this and the Medela Symphony... Spectra rocks. Taking off two starts however, because the replaceable parts already need replacing after just 4 weeks. Totally annoying when you have a hungry newborn at home. They should send extra parts or improve functionality. It should go bad in 3 weeks. The main unit is working fine though and I pump a lot more milk efficiently with this Spectra compared to the Symphony.
customer_reviews.author: samina

customer_reviews.title: If you’re struggling with milk supply, this pump helps
customer_reviews.text: Due to a very difficult labor and c section my milk came in very late. This pump helped me build a really good supply and I have been EPing for over 3 months - and knock wood so far so good! It’s not as silent as it’s advertised but it’s a really Good pump for a suction and power perspective. It is portable but you can’t exactly do house chores with it, the tubes are relatively short and you need to be careful to not spill if you’re walking around with it but at least you can grab yourself a glass of water while pumping if needed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: MUCH more comfortable than my PISA or Symphony
customer_reviews.text: MUCH more comfortable than my PISA or Symphony, but simply didn't have the milk output of the Medela models. It's quiet, and sleek looking, and the nightlight is a great perk. Perhaps I'd recommend that moms start with this pump, so your body is used to it. The softer, suckle motion definitely helps soothe sore mamas, but I just didn't see the same output so I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: MTO

customer_reviews.title: Neither is very comfortable but there is way less tugging and soreness from ...
customer_reviews.text: Have both the Spectra S1 and the Medela PISA. Get about the same output from both. Neither is very comfortable but there is way less tugging and soreness from the Spectra. The bottles on the Spectra tend to fall off while pumping however the Maymam adoptor and the Medela parts do the trick. After 4.5 months of use there is a marked reduction in suction when double pumping using the S1 so I'm Chan my rating to a 3 instead of a 4....my have to revert to the Medela PISA as I'm now having to single pump using the Spectra.
customer_reviews.author: YMW

customer_reviews.title: High pitch sound
customer_reviews.text: I really like my spectra S2 and wanted to buy the S1 because of its battery for going back to work, road trips and hurricane season :). Unfortunately, the pump made a horrible high pitch sound on level 01 and 02 . I returned the pump (no problems with return) and received a replacement pump quickly. Unfortunately, this pump had the same issue. Generally, the pump is pretty loud (not suitable if you are looking for a discrete pumping session at work). Otherwise no problems, I use my Spectra S2 daily at home and it works great. I agree that the flange and bottle come apart too easily.
customer_reviews.author: Julia S.

customer_reviews.title: Best pump on the market and fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: Best pump ever made. Bought it in 2016 for my first baby and now on my third baby in 2020 the pump is still going strong, operating and looking like new. Fantastic design, portability - the fact it doesn’t require to be plugged in while pumping so you can comfortably sit anywhere and you can occasionally get up and do something while pumping. Also love that it’s compatible with both US and European voltage, I’ve traveled with it on several long trips to Europe. I bought the same pump for my sister-in-law in Germany and she loves it too. And so pretty looking too. All in all a fantastic product. Price was excellent as well!!
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Best pump ever
customer_reviews.text: I love this pump, although, It took a bit for me to get used to it and find settings that work for me. It is quiet, lightweight, and I use the nightlight a lot. I can’t speak about the battery life as I have only used it at home and so keep it plugged in when not in use. I use the Spectra S9 when traveling. I would definitely recommend. Way better than the Medela.
customer_reviews.author: Monique

customer_reviews.title: DOESNT HOLD A CHARGE
customer_reviews.text: If I could leave ZERO stars I would. This is my SECOND one I've bought, the first one stopped holding a charge and wont even work if I plug it in and pump so I thought it was a faulty one and bought another well I just got this pump delivered Friday and have charged it and it WONT HOLD A CHARGE for even 2 min. I tried to contact spectra via Facebook and by phone and no response back I am very upset.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: This works fine but was not the amazing pump I expected from reviews. I don't think it's better than the medela pump in style, big difference is this is a closed system and this is cheaper. The closed system is why it's referred to as hospital grade, I don't find the suction any stronger than the pump in style. If you truly need strong suction, rent a symphony that is truly stronger suction. I rented a hospital pump by Medela previously and would have preferred that. You also can't microwave sterilize these, they recommend just soapy water, which I don't think is recommended.
customer_reviews.author: mariabelle01

customer_reviews.title: This is your pump!
customer_reviews.text: Best pump ever! It has great suction but is also not harsh or forceful. I love that this one is rechargeable so you are not married to an outlet. For comparison, I’ve tried the Evenflo pump (horrible suction and takes forever and is an obnoxious sucking motion) and I’ve also rented a hospital grade pump which was honestly not as good as this spectra pump. The charge on this pump lasts a long time too... i pump once a day for about 12 min and I only have to charge it maybe once a week.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pumped fewer ounces with this pump
customer_reviews.text: I did not like this pump. I had a Medela Pump n' Style as my primary pump, and I bought this as my backup. I experimented with various pumping levels/setting but was still coming up short in the amount I was able to pump. At times I would pump with this pump first and see minimal output, then put my other pump on and proceed to get an additional 3-4oz. Every ounce counts for me, so I didn't want to waste my pumping time with this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Pump!
customer_reviews.text: After much research I decided to go with the Spectra S1 & I'm glad I did. The bottles/nipples it comes with are nice & more closely resemble a real nipple than some other bottle brands. I can also slip Lanisoh milk storage bags onto the pump and pump directly into them. This pump also has a good pump strength- I never have a problem with let down and flow. Being a second time mom- I've gotten much more milk with this pump than with the Medela pump provided by the hospital with my first son. The base is portable too which was important for me so I could bring it around the house and for when I return to work.
customer_reviews.author: Nikole

customer_reviews.title: Loved at first but quickly becoming disappointed...
customer_reviews.text: This machine has been my close friend since my son was born almost 4 weeks ago, but it’s already starting to malfunction so I’m really disappointed.. the suction on the bottom option has decided to work only half the time — I have replaced all new parts and all, so it know it is the valve.. And today I go to press the power button and it’s been turning off immediately — I had to turn it on 3 times for it to actually stay on, and it’s not out of battery at all. For the price... this should most definitely last longer than a month!
customer_reviews.author: Brenna Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I have not (extensively) tried any other breast pumps, so I have nothing to compare this product to, but my experience with this has been great. I'll admit that it took me a little while to understand the numbers and to figure out my setting. I did briefly use a Medela pump in the hospital and it was automatically set in terms of suction power, so I wasn't sure how to adjust mine when I got home. I did end up using the Internet to find some suggested settings and then experimented. It's super quiet, though, and there are no frills. Everything is simple and functional.
customer_reviews.author: ARRE

customer_reviews.title: Great breast pump! Use them multiple times daily and no issues
customer_reviews.text: I got the Spectra S2 (non rechargeable) pump through my insurance, and ordered another one to use at home, and also to take to work when I go back. I used a Medela pump at the hospital and definitely prefer the Spectra. The settings on the Medela weren't that intuitive. Also I read that Spectra is the only brand that has a backflow protector. I often take this rechargeable version on the car with me. I have a manual hand pump for emergencies but if you have a car, you might as well take the electric one so you can be hands free (with a hands free bra).
customer_reviews.author: Sven5000

customer_reviews.title: Best decision ever
customer_reviews.text: I seriously cried the first time I had to pump. It wasn’t fun and I was terrified of how it would impact my supply. And I didn’t like how it felt. After a year of my baby drinking milk straight from the tap I was set to go out of town and needed to pump enough for her to snack on or drink while I was gone for 3 days. I was so torn! I finally decided to upgrade my pump to this and I’m so glad it did. I love the instructions. I love the settings. I love the rechargability. Thank you Spectra
customer_reviews.author: Faith

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this pump soooo much quieter than the Medela and I think the settings are better also. I had a Medela for one week and the suction started having problems so I switched over to this one and couldn't be happier. The one thing that I don't like about this one vs. the Medela is that you have to put it into let down mode and then remember to switch it back to regular pumping where as the Medela automatically starts in let down mode and then after 2 minutes switches over to regular pumping automatically.
customer_reviews.author: Ben MacIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Registry MUST have
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet pump. Best part about it is that you can take it on the go without needing to be connected to wires! Love that there is a visible timer so that I know how long I've pumped. The night light is an added bonus that helps for those late night/early morning pump sessions. I also have another pump (hospital grade rental from insurance) to compare it to. Spectra has not gotten moisture in the tubing compared to the rental pump. Noise level is significantly less with Spectra and buttons are intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Work Horse
customer_reviews.text: This is the only pump I've ever used, so unfortunately I can't compare it to anything else. I used this pump for over a year and it hasn't failed me. Battery life is pretty great - it only required charging every few days. I'd always get a good amount of milk every time. Pump parts were replaced only once (probably should've replaced them 2-3x). I found the tubing became loose at the base where it attaches to the pump frequently. The Spectra bottles weren't great (no venting) so I'd transfer the milk to a Dr. Brown's bottle every time. Overall, I don't have any complaints about the Spectra. It's quiet, battery operated and portable and worked very well for me.
customer_reviews.author: thrillhouse

customer_reviews.title: Best pump ever!
customer_reviews.text: This pump is worth every dollar. I exlusively pumped for my daughter until she was 11 months, and this pump made is possible. Its quiet, easy to use, and emptied me well. The battery ran for several days on one charge, so I could pump and drive to work. It has many different settings, and the "let-down" option works wonders. If it wasn't for this pump, I'd have quit a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. V

customer_reviews.title: Leakiest pump ever
customer_reviews.text: System is definitely not quiet and the breast Shield doesn't screw on very nicely because it leaks incredibly and if you have big boobs like I do they don't send you a breast Shield that fits, so when you're using it you have to continuously stop because milk just drips right out of it all over yourself. It's quite a terrible design if you ask me the suction isn't bad, but they need to redesign their entire shed system because it just wastes so much milk. I'm returning mine fore sure.
customer_reviews.author: Caylin

customer_reviews.title: The battery is key!
customer_reviews.text: It’s really a bummer that this version isn’t covered by insurance. The portability / fact that it doesn’t have to be plugged in -which tethers you and your milk — is huge and key. I have the other version and keep it at work, and have this one at home so I can easily move from room to room with it. If I hadn’t gotten the other one for free, I would definitely have just bought this one and carries it back and forth home-work.
customer_reviews.author: Arakashi

customer_reviews.title: Spectra vs Medela Symphony?
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this breast pumps works comparable to the Medela Symphony hospital grade pump. I like both, but for me, the reason why I like this more is that it is cordless and also light in weight (3-4 lbs vs 8 lbs), which makes it easy to travel or commute. It also gives you the ability to change the cycle and suction levels for the letdown and expression phase to your liking. Spectra also has a Facebook forum that you could ask questions and also read other mothers questions and answers. The pump does not come with a bag, so you’d have to look for a bag to store and carry your supplies/pump.
customer_reviews.author: S. So

customer_reviews.title: Must have for breastfeeding/pumping moms
customer_reviews.text: This pump was amazing! I was given another pump from my insurance and ended up taking the plunge and purchasing this pump due to all the wonderful things I’ve heard other say. I was a working mom who was also attending university full time and the charging battery was an amazing feature. I pumped 8-12 times a day for 3 months and it never gave out. I was not an execluaive pumper but I can imagine it would still be a great option. Due to it being a closed system I regifted it to a friend who travels for work and she loves it as well!
customer_reviews.author: Melinna

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this pump!!!
customer_reviews.text: This pump has changed my life. I started out using the Medela Freestyle and it would literally take me days to be able to pump enough for one bottle so I could leave the house for an hour. Bought the Spectra as a last resort when my baby was 5 weeks old and am so glad I did! This pump is not only much more powerful but also more comfortable and easy to use. I also love that it's a closed system. Now I am able to pump enough to always have extra milk on hand, and have even been able to build up a freezer stockpile! I can't believe this awesome pump was half the price of the Freestyle.
customer_reviews.author: ABM1985

customer_reviews.title: Motor has malfunctioned.
customer_reviews.text: The motor in mine has malfunctioned and no longer works at pumping. I am one day out of my return window. Now I’m left to buy another pump and wishing I could get my money back to apply to the cost. Who has money to waste with the cost of daycare and pampers. This pump was used twice a day. I have a medela as well that has been going strong since December and I’m back to using exclusively. I bought the spectra pump to keep at home so I wouldn’t have to transport a pump to and from work. Is there a manufacture’s warranty??
customer_reviews.author: Shatonna C.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I did my research before purchasing this pump it had great feedback from breastfeeding mothers. I love that its portable so I can get up and grab my phone from across the room and has a light in case I need to pump at night. The power is great I usually get 5 ounces of milk combined from both breast. The pieces are easy to clean after using. I highly recommend this pump if you are planning on pumping so far no issues I've been using it for 3 weeks already and have good results.
customer_reviews.author: E. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: S1 How I Love Thee, Let Me Count the Ways!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my god I love this pump. I got the Medela Symphony through my insurance and assumed it was the best pump out there. Wrong. So, so, wrong. I thought pain and pumping just went together. Not with the S1. I'm getting more milk in less time with little to no discomfort. On top of that this pump is lightweight and holds a charge forever! That means that you can pump anywhere you want without having to worry about finding an outlet. That means you can put it in your carry on bag and it won't with you down. Seriously do yourself a favor and get this pump. It changed everything about the experience of pumping for me.
customer_reviews.author: The Basha

customer_reviews.title: Worked three times and broken
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one to my wife and worked well for the three times it was used. My wife was so careful with everything but the machine does not work anymore. We purchased during a visit to the USA but we do not live in the USA and when contacted the manufacturer we were told that “warranty only available in the USA”. We are feeling profoundly disappointed to have purchased a machine of this price that breaks after being used for three times.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Arias

customer_reviews.title: Compatibility = 0
customer_reviews.text: The pump itself is fine, but the amount of pieces is ridiculous. And after a few uses, the backflow protectors stop being snug to fit into one another. I am giving it 2 stars because it has a long battery life. I also hated this pump because it is not compatible with anything. You have to use wide-neck bottles to catch and then use adapters if you want to fill milk into another bottle. Go with the medela because they have collection bottles in many sizes that you can attach and feed. 2oz and up.
customer_reviews.author: awareconsumer

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS PUMP.!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it for 4 months now and I have no complaints. I had a Medela, Ameda and even rented the Medela hospital grade breast pump before buying this pump and NONE of them compared to the Spectra! The reason I gave in a bough this pump was because my milk supply was dropping fast and I was willing to try anything. So glade I did. It also came with extra flanges(funnels) in a different size which was awesome! Worth the $$$$
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended Pump
customer_reviews.text: This pump was recommended by Baby Gear Lab and for good reason. I use it all the time since I am exclusively pumping for my premature baby. It's easy to clean and has great settings. It doesn't have "modes" like the Medela used in the hospital but you can choose the right settings quite easily. I like that it doesn't have to be plugged in all the time which makes it easy to pump "cords-free" in bed. I use it with the Medela collection cups so had to buy a narrow adapter. The bottles that the Spectra comes with are kind of sucky. My only complaint is the tubes. They seem to randomly like to pop off.
customer_reviews.author: Alicein Wonderland

customer_reviews.title: No Adapter Included
customer_reviews.text: Hello, my wife and I are expecting, and knowing this was the best pump on the market I thought I'd surprise her with the pump. Our baby is due early, but sadly, this product did not including the required AC adapter to actually charge the pump. What an utter and complete failure of packaging and sales. I'm disappointed in Spectra for having such poor quality control and I'm suspect of the product's overall quality due to this.
customer_reviews.author: James Rubec

customer_reviews.title: the best breast pump!
customer_reviews.text: I love my spectra s1 so much that this is the second one I have purchased. I bought my first one in 2016 with the birth of my first baby. I had a great pumping experience with it and so I purchased a second one in 2019 with the birth of my second baby. I use my spectra with freemie cups (open system) and with the included tubing/flanges. It is great at home, at work, and in the car. I cannot recommend this pump enough!
customer_reviews.author: Mommydoctor

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling
customer_reviews.text: The S1 has the battery pack and I love that I can pump in the car and not have to worry about additional cables. The charge of the battery lasts a few days and it is extremely convinient. Makes it very easy to transport. I use it with the Freemie cups and i can walk around if needed. The settings are versitile and allow for personalized settings. Love the pump.
customer_reviews.author: Bean

customer_reviews.title: Go for it! Fantastic pump.
customer_reviews.text: The best pump! I wish I had this pump from day one— it is gentle and I get such great output from using it. I love that it is battery operated so I can position it where I need to. It is also super quiet compared to the other pumps I’ve tried. Few tips— you can get adapters to use your medela flanges if you find that the Spectra ones aren’t quite right for you. I would also recommend using microwaveable hot pads that fit around the flange for maximum output.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret E. Sheldon

customer_reviews.title: Best pump in the market! Hands down!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best pump hands down. I used 3 different medela and the specta is the best for all the features it has. Just get this pump, I will save you some time and is cheaper compared to the others brands. It doesn't make me sore or itchy after each pump. It give you a sense of massage. After doing so much research this is the best. Dont even bother to check others brands. Once you get the spectra this is a game changer.
customer_reviews.author: J L

customer_reviews.title: Great portable or stationary pump.
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I gave this pump a try. I had a Medela Pump and Go with my first child 8 years ago and it worked but wasn’t the easiest to clean, was noisy in my opinion and I just didn’t like it. I decided to try the Spectra after reading lots of reviews and am very pleased with it!! It’s super quiet, has a night light, is rechargeable and easy to assemble and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Mechelle Braswell

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about buying this pump due to the mixed reviews but I knew my Medela pump wasn’t working for me and I wanted to try this one out. Needless to say I LOVE this pump and am so glad I did ordered it! Battery life is amazing, the little light on the pump is perfect for pumping in the middle of the night when I need to without waking up anyone. It’s quiet and convenient. There are many settings on it that you can adjust to make it perfect for you. Needless to say, I love everything about this! It’s a must have for all the new mamas out there!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Out-suckles the Competition!
customer_reviews.text: Pros; COMFORTABLE! easy to operate, BATTERY! Cons; plastic bottle This pump has a lot going for it. It has a bunch of settings so you can find the exact suckle that works for you. We had fun testing it on my husband lol. We love that it has a battery for travel. The only issue is that it doesn't fit our glass bottles and we have to use the plastic bottles that it came with. ALL PLASTIC parts ARE BPA and DEHP so it's okay. It has more setting and is over $100 cheaper than the popular Medela. It also looks better! Verdict: A must have! Let me know if this helped :) T&A
customer_reviews.author: A. Garaventa

customer_reviews.title: Great pump and great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I exclusively pumped with my first child do to a NICU stay and latch issues. This pump worked much better for me than the medela and I love that I can pump without being plugged in! I’m currently pregnant with our second so I broke out my spectra to make sure I had all the parts, I charged it and found that it would only charge to up 2 bars. I was disappointed because I was hoping to use it for our second child as well. I contacted customer service via email and found out they have a 2 year warranty! My new spectra is on the way and I’m so thrilled with the service I received!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Just buy the Spectra already.
customer_reviews.text: Stop reading reviews. Get thee a Spectra S1. My insurance didn't cover one, but it was worth buying it. (Resale value is high, too, so you can recoup a lot of the money you put into buying one.) Works better than the hospital-grade rentals I had and is so much more portable. Rechargable internal battery is amazing. Hot tip: Spectra flange threads fit Avent wide-neck bottles (both anti-colic and natural), so you can pump directly into them. Anything to save on the washing up is great. Pumping sucks, but this pump made it easier.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel and work!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite pump! It has so many less parts as compared to other brands out there. It’s very gentle and I love that it is rechargeable so I don’t have to worry when I go to work, if there is an outlet near where I’m pumping. Also works great for travel! I used this on a 10 hour car ride and it worked great! Holds the charge for a long time. I can use this pretty well for 1-2 days without recharging. Definitely recommend charging whenever you have a chance so that you don’t even end up without power.
customer_reviews.author: Mel KTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Freestyle is out; Spectra S1 is winner.
customer_reviews.text: I'm in Canada and we don't get this pump. I've seen all the reviews and chatted with many moms that use this pump. I was a Medela Freestyle user previously and had this shipped to me. I'm now confidently a Spectra S1 fan. It's much softer on the nipples and the suction (aka vacuum) is much nicer. This is way quieter then the Medela Freestyle and it emptied me much quicker. It is different than the Freestyle because it starts in Expression mode but this is easily changed by a quick button press. I highly recommend this (although it is twice the size of the freestyle).
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Better than medela
customer_reviews.text: Replacement items are expensive especially the duckbills that should be replaced monthly. My biggest complaint is that the bottles are loose fitting on the flanges and come unscrewed way too easily resulting sometimes in spilled milk. I even bought adapters to use with my Medela bottles but same problem. I am able to express more milk with my spectra compared to my Medela pumps and I love the built in battery and night light. I do wish the pump itself was more square in shape so it would fit better in my bag I use as pump bag at work
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was recommended this pump on a moms group on Facebook, I am so glad I bought it!!! It is the best pump ive ever used. It’s quite, convenient, portable, I love the little night light it has and that it’s a closed system so it doesn’t get bacteria in the motor. It times how long you pump and shows the cycle and vacuum levels. The first time I used it I pumped 8oz in 15 min. The second time I used it I pumped 9.5oz in 15min. It is a really good pump so far from my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Tiara Davis

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I ever bought
customer_reviews.text: Best thing I ever bought! Was definitely worth paying a little extra for the rechargeable feature on the more expensive model! I have used this inside the car while my husband drove and on break at work. I also can pump while I brush my hair, teeth etc because I’m not stuck plugged into a wall. This also creates a different sensation when sucking- it’s more like fluttering which reminds me more of when my baby feeds. I hate madella now after using this. Used to hurt my nipples and lose suction constantly. Only downside to this I guess is the tubes come unplugged kind of easily but it’s still worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this pump. Previously I used a Medela, which was good, but louder and not easily portable. I am very satisfied with the versatility in pump options. I highly recommend this pump.
customer_reviews.author: Karolina A Mallahan

customer_reviews.title: Best pump we’ve ever had.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife for her and our second daughter. With our first daughter, she never pumped because of the pain/discomfort of the pump we had then. She was a stay at home mom then so not pumping was something we could get away with. She won’t be a stay at home mom for our second daughter so we needed a new pump. I did some research and this pump had the best reviews I could find. And man, were they right. My wife loves this pump. She’s been pumping 2-3 times a day since we got home from the hospital and has had no pain/discomfort with this pump. We couldn’t be happier with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Broc

customer_reviews.title: Highly reccomend
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of shopping and research before I purchased this pump. Very glad I went with this brand and model. I've used it 6 weeks now. The charging feature is incredibly useful, because the baby is not going to wait for you to finish pumping. You've got to jump up all the time to retrieve things or change the baby. It's also a lifesaver if you're going out of the house, because you don't have to depend on finding a power outlet. The nightlight is also a feature that has been unexpectedly handy.
customer_reviews.author: Viking Squirrel

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: We were trying to decide between this and renting the Symphony. My wife is so happy with this pump. Works as well as the symphony that she tried in the hospital. If you are trying to decide between the corded and cordless, definitely consider spending the extra money and buying the cordless. The convenience of taking the pump anywhere has been so helpful.
customer_reviews.author: P. Katiraei

customer_reviews.title: I love this pump
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this pump for four months so far and I love it. It holds a charge forever so I have only had to plug it in a few times to charge. The suction is great, it's easy to clean all the parts, and the light on it comes in handy when pumping in the middle of the night. I would definitely recommend this to any nursing/pumping mom. It's the best pump I ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Lia

customer_reviews.title: Great pump
customer_reviews.text: Love this pump! I love how the vacuum and speed settings are both adjustable so you can get the best output and can be customizable for each person as well as throughout your pump session if needed or over the course of your breastfeeding journey. It's definitely more gentle than the Medela pump in style advance I used through two children! I used this spectra pump three times a day five days a week for almost a year at work (went back when baby was 3 months and stopped pumping at 14 months). I never had any issues with it and it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: SD mom

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, portable, awesome breast pump
customer_reviews.text: Hands down my favorite hospital grade breast pump. I love the night light, cup holder and most importantly the auto shut off. It's super light weight so you can pump on the go! Its also awesome that you dont have to be plugged in to pump. You can do dishes and fold clothes all while pumping lol! Highly recommend especially with all the different settings you can make it totally customizable for your total comfort level!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: FAR superior to what we used at the hospital
customer_reviews.text: this is an INCREDIBLY well designed and thought out product. FAR superior to what we used at the hospital. I dont know why medela even bothers trying. We opted to pay full price for this one instead of getting the medela for barely 20% of its sticker price via insurance and I dont regret that decision for even 1 second. I only wish the breast cups were removable for easier use with breast pump bras. But we're talking like a 15 second time savings.
customer_reviews.author: Shrimant Saxena

customer_reviews.title: highly recommend Spectra Rechargable Electric breastpump
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical at first to spend this much money on a breast pump but I am so glad I did. My daughter simply loves this breast pump. She has found it to be extremely easy to use, a very easy process to clean and she said it works amazingly well. It is very quiet to operate and you can pump 1 side at a time or both.
customer_reviews.author: teri

customer_reviews.title: Twin mama approved!
customer_reviews.text: I have twins and this pump has been a lifesaver when it comes to keeping my milk supply up. A lot of people told me I had to get a "hospital grade" pump to do the job, but this pump has been absolutely amazing and convenient. I went to the lactation consultant who had me pump using the Medela Symohony and this pump expresses as much milk from me as the Medela.
customer_reviews.author: Galaxyirides

customer_reviews.title: Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Quiet, customizable, comfortable. The standby battery life on this thing is amazing. I dont think I've charged this thing in weeks. It's so quiet that I'm able to use it in bed without waking my husband. I love all the different settings depending on what kind of pumping session i need. This thing is a lifesaver when I'm engorged. My little guy is either too fast or too slow when im engorged, causing me pain. I use this pump to relieve the pain.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: and by far I love the Spectra the best
customer_reviews.text: I have Medela Pump in style, Ameda, and Manual Avent, and by far I love the Spectra the best. Very easy to go around with it, its light in weight and fits every bag (almost), its quiet (I even took work meetings while pumping and nobody noticed), and it works very well (I thought it was better than the rest). The fact that I can charge it was great as well and helpful. I pumped for both my kids, almost over 2 years (total), and I would recommend the Spectra one for moms that needs to pump, especially on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Mid-west68

customer_reviews.title: Can you be in love with a breast pump
customer_reviews.text: Can you be in love with a breast pump?! Yeah it's amazing. I've been a avid medela symphony user for my last two kiddos. The spectra is more customizable. You can change the speed and intensity of the pump AND it remembers your settings. The nightlight is a neat function for early morning pumping sessions and the timer on the pump means I don't need to grab my phone and time my session. The battery pack is SO worth the extra money. I've pumped approximately 4 hours collectively and it still says I have half of my battery life! Wish I had bought one of these sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Adrianne

customer_reviews.title: VERY DISAPPOINTED!!
customer_reviews.text: DISAPPOINTED!!! I bought this 3 months ago, but did not start using until August 10th when baby was born. Well today, 3 days after, the pump would not suction. I tried switching out the parts and it just would not work. I should not have to worry about the parts when I have only used this machine for 3 days!! I do NOT recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Neri

customer_reviews.title: Is it weird to say I love a breast pump?
customer_reviews.text: Love it. This is the fourth week I've used this pump and I've already seen an increase in my production. It's so nice to be able to adjust the suction and length of the "sucks" independently of one another. And it's way cuter and cheaper than my medela PISA I used with my first baby. It doesn't come with a bag, but I just bought a cute bag to carry all of my pump stuff to and from work. Not a big deal for me. If you need bigger collection bottles, the avent natural bottles fit perfectly and they more readily available.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan Glasgow

customer_reviews.title: The bottles leak from between the threads
customer_reviews.text: This PUMP is awesome. The pieces? Not so much. The bottles leak from between the threads if they get tilted. I bought medela accessories and a little yellow adapter so i could use them instead.
customer_reviews.author: Natalya the Spy

customer_reviews.title: The best pump on the market
customer_reviews.text: THANK YOU SPECTRA! I cannot tell you how much this machine saved my pumping experience. I started with the Medela pump in style, and was barely getting any milk. THEN, the PIS blew through two power cords and two batter packs. I was seriously considering quitting breastfeeding around four months because I didn't know how I would go on. So I decided to try the Spectra. WHAT A DIFFERENCE. I immediately saw more milk produced, never had an issue with power, and I pumped until my son was a year. (Okay, a year minus one week). Plus, it's cheaper. Pumping definitely sucks, but this was a lifesaver for me.
customer_reviews.author: Evie FoxTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: BEST PUMP EVER
customer_reviews.text: I had the PISA with my 1st child but wasn't effective and had to rent a hospital grade. With my second I bought this and never will I use another pump. I used it from the start since I had an oversupply and pumped for 15 months. I love the rechargeable battery because it allowed me to pump anywhere at any time. I do recommend ordering some extra parts ahead of time before you need them and the adaption for the Medela bottles.
customer_reviews.author: cricket

customer_reviews.title: The Best Pump Ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great breast pump! I’ve used Medela in the past as well as Avent but Spectra tops them both! Here’s why: 1. Painless 2. Pumps effectively 3. Super quiet 4. Easy to operate 5. Easy to clean! This pump is really getting the job done and I can pump multiple bottles between nursing my baby pain free! Oh and I love the night light!
customer_reviews.author: Chon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value
customer_reviews.text: If I can give this 10 stars then I would. It is a great pump and works as well as the 2k symphony pump from the hospital. The suction is more of a gentle motion instead of the painful tugging from the $300 pump we got initially from the insurance company. Despite the gentle motion of the pump, it pumps out more milk in less amount of time. The pump also is much more quiet than the pump we got from the insurance company. Highly recommend to all mothers pumping. Get the one with the battery pack so you can carry it around the house.
customer_reviews.author: babiesrfatTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Should've gotten this one from the beginning
customer_reviews.text: LOVE my new pump! I got the Ameda Purely Yours through insurance, but felt it lose power and stopped collecting as much milk after just 2 months. I read about this pump on a LLL page and decided to take a chance. Best decision! Some highlights: - Strong. Haven't had any issues with it getting weaker! - Let-down massage button. Great once there's a letdown versus manually adjusting the pump. - PORTABLE!!! This version is chargeable, so I can pump everywhere! - Flashlight. Super convenient for middle-of-the-night-trying-not-to-wake-anyone times. All in all, a very good pump for a very reasonable price!
customer_reviews.author: eak

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this. After a failed attempt at nursing my ...
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this. After a failed attempt at nursing my 4th baby exclusively, I was about to give up on it altogether and start buying formula. Read some reviews of Mom groups and here and so glad I got this! It’s portable so I can pump in my car at soccer practice or piano, I can take it with me wherever we go so I’m not tied to my bed for pump sessions. It’s a double pump, so it doesn’t take me forever to pump one side and then the other. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Love this pump!
customer_reviews.text: I will start by saying I have been using Medela PISA. I pump exclusively and needed a second pump to leave at work. My first time pumping with the Spectra, I was highly impressed. The suction mimics a baby sucking. This pump is SO much quieter than the PISA. I read reviews that mentioned this and that was one of my CONS with the PISA. I felt like I was going crazy listening to the pump 8-10 times a day. With the Spectra, I was able to pump an ounce more in less time!! This is by far my most favorite purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jade Tyree

customer_reviews.title: Love this pump!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t sure about wich brand to buy (at last I was between Medela or Spectra) I searched a lot and read the comments so I decided for Spectra and I’m so happy, love it. The machine do a little noise when pumping it would be great less noise, not to worry about it, but if you have a sensitive ear baby , he/she can hear the noise when sleeping. I can’t compare it with others brands because is the first one I try but I recomend it. I didn’t give 5 stars because when I received the pump it had a scratch by one side, Don’t know if was the seller or the shipping company... even so it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandra X Merino

customer_reviews.title: very happy and thanksful
customer_reviews.text: Very useful for moms who breast pump only. Helps me a lot. Now I can get about 6 oz in 20 min. I don’t like the memory of the spectra. The rest is fine. It is not as small and durable as Avent but works better and can solve feeding issues if any.
customer_reviews.author: Mariluys Yeremyan

customer_reviews.title: This pump works great, very versatile
customer_reviews.text: This pump works great, very versatile, at full charge, it will last about 4 pump sessions. My wife had a hospital grade pump rental (Medella Symphony) for the 1st 2 months after birth from Kaiser. After the free rental was up, we struggled to find a compatible hospital grade pump that works as well as the Symphony (but won't break our pocket, it's priced at $2000 to buy or $50/month rental). This Spectra S1 is only $200, which is a fraction of that Symphony but works 90% as well and even better because it's portable. We strongly recommend it for new mom that pumps for their newborn.
customer_reviews.author: WinWin

customer_reviews.title: Stoped working properly
customer_reviews.text: I loved mine while it lasted. Baby is almost 9 months. I really liked it but the auction started to suck a week from now. Disappointing as I had a mécelas with my first one that it lasted forever. I decided to give this one a try and get rid of the there one 🤦🏻‍♀️ Because I didn’t like the rubbing system. I still have until he’s 18 months and I would love for the company to help me with this issue because really is not even a year.
customer_reviews.author: grace

customer_reviews.title: Waaaayyyy better than Medela!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Medela for the past 6 weeks. I had an issue with it and had to return it. My sister insisted that I try the Spectra. She said that it pumps more milk per session and is easier to use and much quieter. She was right. I am pumping twice as much milk with the Spectra as I was pumping with Medela. The fit of the cups is better, the machine is more high tech and easy to use and it is quieter. Wish I had started with this one! Skip Medela and get the Spectra! Plus its CHEAPER!
customer_reviews.author: Johannah Williams

customer_reviews.title: No other pump compares.
customer_reviews.text: By far the best pump. My motor stopped working 5 months in after daily use 8x per day (exclusive pumper). Luckily it was under warranty with the spectra company (manufacturers warranty). They responded within hours and mailed me a new pump right away. While waiting for replacement spectra yo arrive I went and purchased a lansinoh smart pump which is 100.00$ more ... dissapointed in that after using spectra. Suction isnt as good. Spare parts not as affordable as spectra and you lose suction when using batteries. The spectra suction did not change.. in fact i ussually only used it on battery and charged it at night. It is bulky but worth every penny. I
customer_reviews.author: ALI

customer_reviews.title: Greatest pump ever, gentle and efficient
customer_reviews.text: Love so much! Doesn’t hurt my nipples like the Madela PIS. I produce as much as I did with the Madela hospital-grade pump that I rented postpartum. The suction is a little weaker than a hospital-grade pump and I do need to hand massage during pumping to express all the milk, but it still works great for me. Portability is KEY for me so the good battery pack helps me be mobile, and the suction is not affected whether it’s plugged in or not. It’s very quiet, light weight and mobile. I highly recommend this pump to ALL PUMPING MOMS. It’s superior to the store-bought Madela pumps, in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works for me!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so pleased with this pump. I've been using it now for two weeks. It's lightweight, portable, easy to setup, easy to use and has a nightlight. This is my first pump and I have nothing to compare it to, but it works for me. I do wish it came with spare parts. I am a little nervous about accidentally damaging a part (or my cat damaging it) and not having a spare.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Days

customer_reviews.title: It randomly stopped working!
customer_reviews.text: WARNING! I bought this pump in my third trimester so my insurance would pay for it! My daughter was born beginning of June and my I am exclusively pumping with her and it just stopped working today for NO REASON! My daughter is 2 months old and now I have cabbage leaves on and I am forced to stop pumping! So incredibly disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Papko

customer_reviews.title: It was way better than the medella I was using the first few ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this pump for almost a year. It was way better than the medella I was using the first few weeks after having my little one. It’s quiet, the charge used to lasted me days sometimes almost a week! It has a night light! Lots of setting to choose from, easy to use. I recommend this pump to all my mama friends.
customer_reviews.author: Anna banana

customer_reviews.title: Will die before you get done breastfeeding.
customer_reviews.text: I loved loved loved this pump and couldn't say enough good things about it until it died. It hasn't even been a year and it died, I'm currently still breastfeeding and it just stopped suctioning mid pump. I was hoping to invest in this pump to have it for all my kids. I would say I used it about once a week for the first 5 months because I'm at stay at home mom and could feed my son. I just started solids so I started pumping once a day before bed so I could use that milk in rice cereal. I'm devastated. Wish you better luck then me. :(
customer_reviews.author: Brennah

customer_reviews.title: Overall a great pump indeed!
customer_reviews.text: The pump is very cute, and it works! The night light function is very useful when I need to pump in the middle of the night. It's bright enough for me to mange the set up for pumping and labeling the milk bottles afterwards. It's also very quiet while in use, and one full charge can last many pumping sessions. The only thing I don't like about this pump is its size. It's not very practical to bring it to work everyday as it barely fits in a large Skiphop diaper bag...
customer_reviews.author: MeawTheCatz

customer_reviews.title: Great quiet pump, excellent customer care
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research i to pumps and this one was by far the best for a good price! Very quiet, more quiet that the Madela (I own both). I definitely recommend watching some youtube channels about how to use this pump and most importantly that you are using correct flange size. Had an issue 3 months after purchasing it and customer service was very quick and very helpful! 5 stars!!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Wand

customer_reviews.title: GAME CHANGER!
customer_reviews.text: I previously had the Medela Pump In Style Advanced, I was unhappy with it as there was no way to control the suction other than by the dial which didn't do much good and I wasn't responding well to that. I purchased this S1 pump and I am in LOVE! pumping is not a chore anymore, I actually enjoy pumping and not being connected to the wall is even better. At first I wasn't sure if the extra money was worth being about to charge and go but let me tell you I would pay for that ability 10X's over.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley westerfield

customer_reviews.title: Spectra's suction is better and so expresses better
customer_reviews.text: I have both the Ameda and spectra. I use ameda at work and spectra wins hands down. Spectra's suction is better and so expresses better. And also has a wider range in r speed and suction. I'll carry that to work since its faster but it's bigger which is the only downside in comparison to ameda. Plus the ameda is so noisy. Spectra for the win.
customer_reviews.author: Milly

customer_reviews.title: Busy working mom of 2
customer_reviews.text: I had to have a quiet pump. I don't want to feel like a machine. This thing is pretty quiet! I nurse and pump at the same time and my baby doesn't get bothered and falls asleep. with a full battery, I have gotten maybe 6 pumps and its at 3/4 full. Thats pretty solid I think. I haven't drained the battery out yet. I think this is great for women who are busy. I go up and down the stairs a lot and this machine is not heavy at all. I like the suction, its comfortable. You get two sizes of those nipple things and Im glad because I did not like the bigger size.
customer_reviews.author: MOMMY ME

product_meta.title: Spectra Baby USA S1Plus Electric Breast Pump
product_meta.description:
Loved by moms and lactation consultants worldwide, the Spectra S1 Plus Premier RECHARGEABLE Breast Pump is designed to bring confidence and comfort to every moment of the breastfeeding journey. The S1 is portable and quickly rechargeable for active moms, and also quiet and discreet for soothing pumping. The added night light allows you to easily pump at any hour. This pump conveniently weighs only 2.9lbs. With a maximum suction strength of 250mmHg and the ability to be used as a single or double pump, the S1 will be a great asset in your breastfeeding journey. The S1's completely flexible, touch button, with the S1 pump's digital controls allow you to set the pumping program to the speed and rhythm most effective for your body. The suction is adjustable in both let-down and expression mode. This quiet pump also includes a timer. 
Our Founder, Heidi Humphries, insisted on the quietest motor available for the S1Plus, which when in the “massage mode” simulates the natural suckling of baby. Spectra Baby spent years developing features for the S1 Plus like “backflow protection” to keep your breast milk from harmful bacteria. We thought hard about things like “adjustable suction levels” because it provides a more natural flow of milk.

We are moms. We are nurses. We understand.
feature_bullets: Includes: Spectra S1 Hospital Grade Double/Single breast pump, 12 volt AC power adapter, detachable power cord prongs, (2) Spectra wide neck bottle, (2) Spectra backflow protector, (2) Spectra duckbill valve, (2) Spectra tubing, (4) flange (2-24mm & 2-28mm)

Closed system: No need to clean the narrow tubing because Spectra S1 has a closed pumping system that keeps tubing dry by preventing air flow between expressed milk and pump tubing while pumping protecting breast milk and baby from bacteria and mold
Rechargeable battery: Spectra S1 has a convenient, inbuilt rechargeable battery

Customizable settings: Each mother can customize her pump’s settings to her own body’s response and follow her flow to find her own best settings with the S1's completely adjustable suction and 2 phase cycling in let-down and expression mode
Mommy owned: Spectra Baby USA is owned and run by registered nurses, board certified lactation consultants, and more importantly… by moms

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,512 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
